details.title: From the middle
details.content:
It's a nice and windy afternoon here at the Bay Oval.

A look at the pitch for the 3rd ODI #NZvIND pic.twitter.com/pbbaSBhEgf

— BCCI (@BCCI) January 28, 2019

details.title: Play!
details.content: Kiwi openers Colin Munro and Martin Guptill come out to the middle. Guptill faces the first delivery from Bhuvneshwar Kumar and gets off the mark with a single.

details.title: Pandya is back
details.content:
Hardik Pandya returns but no MS Dhoni in India XI!

New Zealand win the toss and elect to bat in the third ODI at the Bay Oval.#NZvIND LIVE ⏬
https://t.co/C81irz9QmP pic.twitter.com/NGjLNiDKuC

— ICC (@ICC) January 28, 2019

details.title: Pressure on Munro
details.content:
No pressure Colin, you're only batting for your career (hopefully)#NZvIND

— Jono Fair (@sleeping_beasts) January 28, 2019

details.title: First boundary!
details.content: Colin Munro goes over Mohammed Shami's head as the ball reaches the boundary on one bounce. New Zealand: 8/0

details.title: Munro is gone!
details.content:
Munro was dropped by DK behind the wicket in the very next delivery after the boundary but Shami gets his man in the last ball of his first over. He has Munro caught at first slip by Rohit Sharma. 

New Zealand: 10/1 in 2 overs

The in-form Mohammad Shami with the early strike!

Colin Munro, dropped earlier in the over by Dinesh Karthik, is caught at slip https://t.co/AegV0QcM37 #NZvIND pic.twitter.com/iwgFo9D7mu

— ESPNcricinfo (@ESPNcricinfo) January 28, 2019

details.title: Maiden over!
details.content:
Bhuvneshwar Kumar bowls a brilliant maiden as Martin Guptill tries to settle in. Kane Williamson has joined him in the middle. 

New Zealand: 10/1 in 3 overs.

details.title: Another good over!
details.content:
Williamson plays five dot balls from Shami and gets off in the mark with the single in the last ball.

New Zealand: 11/1 in 4 overs.

details.title: Maximum!
details.content: Right out off the middle,that's a six! Martin Guptill flicks off the pads and clears the mid-wicket boundary.

details.title: 11 off the over
details.content:
Expensive one! Martin Guptill gets another ball on the pads from Bhuvi and he goes over mid-on for a four.

New Zealand: 22/1 in 5 overs.

details.title: Skipper on song
details.content:
'That's Williamson at his best', Kiwi legend Scott Styris says on air as Williamson punches one off Shami through extra covers. 

New Zealand: 26/1 in 6 overs.

details.title: Guptill falls
details.content:
Openers fail again! Martin Guptill is out as he knicks a Bhuvi delivery to DK. Kiwis in trouble here.

Ross Taylor joins Williamson. 

New Zealand: 26/2

details.title: FACTS
details.content:
Indian bowlers dismissing Martin Guptill most times in ODIs:

3 - Bhuvneshwar Kumar
3 - Praveen Kumar
3 - Mohammed Shami
3 - Hardik Pandya
3 - Umesh Yadav #NZvIND

— Ravi Singh (@Iam07ravi) January 28, 2019

details.title: Did you get your coffee?
details.content:
Monday Morning

via GIPHY

details.title: Four!
details.content:
Superb! Williamson times it well off the front foot and beats mid-off for a boundary. 

New Zealand: 36/2 in 9 overs.

details.title: Dhoni's misses
details.content:
@msdhoni missing ODIs because of Injury or Illness in his entire career

Today 🆚️ NZ | 2019 | Hamstring
3 ODIs 🆚️ WI | 2013 | Hamstring
2 ODIs 🆚️ IRE & SA | 2007 | Fever #Dhoni #NZvIND #TeamIndia pic.twitter.com/k2iRaca1L8

— Shekh Zaid (@ShekhZaid1) January 28, 2019

details.title: Spin attack
details.content:
Yuzvendra Chahal comes into the attack in the last over of the first powerplay. Williamson finishes off the over with a boundary as Kiwis get 6 runs from it.

At the end of 10: New Zealand 42/2 (Williamson 19*, Ross Taylor 3*)

details.title: Pandya into the attack
details.content:
Indian all-rounder is back in action after a controversial lay-off from cricket. Good start for Pandya as he gives away only one run from his first over.

New Zealand: 43/2 in 11 overs.

details.title: 50 up!
details.content:
Williamson brings the Kiwis' 50 with a brilliant four on the leg-side. No chance for the mid-wicket fielder to stop this one.

New Zealand: 50/2 in 12 overs.

details.title: Kuldeep into the attack
details.content:
Virat Kohli introduces his chinaman! Kuldeep Yadav bowls a good first over, only one from it.

New Zealand: 51/2 in 13 overs

details.title: Remembering the legend!
details.content:
#OnThisDay in 1873, Monty Noble, one of Australia's great all-rounders was born.

Noble averaged 30.25 with the bat and just 25.00 with the ball in his 42 Test career. pic.twitter.com/4gFgOHKFdh

— ICC (@ICC) January 28, 2019

details.title: Powerplay scores
details.content:
New Zealand's Powerplay 1 scores this series:
1st ODI - 34/2
2nd ODI - 63/2
3rd ODI - 42/2
Powerplay 1 scores vs India in 2019:
41/2
38/2
30/2
34/2
63/2
42/2
Good to see Indian bowler taking early breakthrough. #NZvIND @BhuviOfficial @MdShami11 @bcci

— Vishal Pandey (@ImVishal100) January 28, 2019

details.title: Rebuilding
details.content:
Williamson and Taylor are looking good as they try to build a partnership here.

New Zealand: 59/2 in 16 overs.

Partnership: 33 runs

details.title: Williamson gone!
details.content:
What a catch! Pandya dives on his left at short mid-wicket and takes a blinder to remove the New Zealand skipper off Chahal. Williamson scored 28 runs. 

New Zealand: 59/3

details.title: Tactical, was it?
details.content:
Hardik Pandya 0/6 in 3 overs and a solid diving catch at short midwicket since return. That was a tactical CoA suspension.#NZvIND

— Suneer (@suneerchowdhary) January 28, 2019

details.title: Harsha speaks
details.content:
The other reason India wanted Pandya back so quickly. Brilliant in the field.

— Harsha Bhogle (@bhogleharsha) January 28, 2019

details.title: Pandya, the bowler!
details.content:
Hardik Pandya has started off well with the ball giving away just 8 runs from 4 overs. 

New Zealand: 62/3 in 18 overs.

details.title: Boundaries dry up
details.content:
Tom Latham and Ross Taylor try to score as much by running between the wickets as boundaries are not coming. Dot balls from Pandya and Chahal keeps the pressure on the Kiwis.

New Zealand: 75/3 in 21 overs.

details.title: Have a look at the catch
details.content:
#teamindia #HardikPandya
Awesome catch ... pic.twitter.com/41Ap3cQLJP

— shankar more (@We_Indians_) January 28, 2019

details.title: Everyone is impressed
details.content:
Hardik pandya : "aaj main catch karke aaya"

pic.twitter.com/Y4l7eDqaVb

— New Age Indian (@NewAgeIndian1) January 28, 2019

details.title: Shami brought back
details.content:
Mohammed Shami starts his second spell well. Almost gets a catch off his own bowling. 

New Zealand: 84/3 in 23 overs

details.title: Much needed boundary
details.content:
Tom Latham gets his first boundary courtesy sloppy fielding at fine leg by Rayudu off Kuldeep Yadav. 

New Zealand: 91/3 in 24 overs.

details.title: 100 up
details.content:
New Zealand bring up their hundred as Latham and Taylor try to build a partnership here.

New Zealand: 101/3 in 26 overs

Partnership: 42

details.title: Sloppy on field
details.content:
Purely based on how useless @RayuduAmbati is in the field, we should probably look for other batsmen for the @icc #WorldCup2019 squad. #NZvIND

— Ankur Saini (@sainiankur) January 28, 2019

details.title: 50 runs partnership
details.content:
Latham and Taylor rebuild after three early wickets as they put on 50 runs for the fourth wicket.

New Zealand: 113/3 (Taylor 35*, Latham 26*)

details.title: Review!
details.content:
The Indian team appeal for an LBW against Ross Taylor. After two reviews (one for LBW and the other for run-out), Kiwis were was confirmed not out.

New Zealand: 126/3 in 29 overs

details.title: Fifty for Ross Taylor
details.content: The star batsman brings up his half-century after hitting two consecutive fours off Kedar Jadhav. This is Taylor's first fifty of the series and he will be the key in finishing it off well for the Kiwis.

details.title: Drinks
details.content: New Zealand: 144/3 in 32 overs

details.title: Dhoni factor
details.content:
#crickbuzzlive #crickbuzz

Dhoni impact in the middle overs clearly visible, spintwins struggling to get wickets#NZvIND #INDvNZ

— |\/| ∆ |\| |_| (@ManuManjunath8) January 28, 2019

details.title: Century-stand
details.content:
Latham and Taylor put on 100 runs for the fourth wicket as New Zealand try to accelerate the run-rate before going into the last 10 overs.

New Zealand: 160/3 in 35 overs

Partnership: 101 runs

details.title: SIX!
details.content:
That's a biggie! Comes down the wicket, picks it up with the spin and dispatches it over long leg boundary for a maximum. 

New Zealand: 171/3 in 36 overs

details.title: OUT!
details.content:
Finally broken! New Zealand lose their fourth wicket in the form of Tom Latham who just got to his fifty. He holes it out to Rayudu at deep mid-wicket off Chahal.

New Zealand: 178/4

details.title: From the stadium
Taylor continues
details.content:
Despite losing his century stand partner Tom Latham, Ross Taylor continues as he hits Bhuvi to the third man boundary for 4. Henry Nicholls there to support him on the other end. 

New Zealand: 187/4 in 39 overs

details.title: WICKET!
details.content:
Hardik Pandya gets his first wicket on return as he has Henry Nicholls caught behind off a short delivery. New Zealand seem to have lost the way after Taylor-Latham partnership.

New Zealand: 191/5 in 40 overs.

details.title: Hasn't Pandya been brilliant on the field today?
details.content:
Diana Edulji hiding after Hardik Pandya's performance#NZvIND pic.twitter.com/0KGamELKMA

— Lord Commander (@Holdthedoor19) January 28, 2019

details.title: Hardik gets another wicket
details.content:
Mitchell Santner departs as Pandya gets him caught behind for 3 runs. Kiwis in trouble here as Ross Taylor looks stranded on one end. 

New Zealand: 198/6 in 41.3 overs

details.title: Pandya's return so far
details.content: via GIPHY

details.title: 200 up
details.content:
New Zealand reach 200 for the loss six wickets. 

Score: NZ- 201/6 (Taylor 81*, Bracewell 3*)  in 42 overs

details.title: Shami in for his third spell
details.content:
Shami is brought into the attack and he gives away 8 runs off his seventh over. Taylor gets a boundary in the over. Doug Bracewell is playing the second fiddle well. 

New Zealand: 214/6 in 44 overs

details.title: Taylor into the 90s
details.content:
Ross Taylor gets a top edge off Pandya as the ball races away to the fine-leg boundary.

New Zealand: 222/6 in 45 overs

details.title: WICKET! Ross Taylor gone
details.content:
Misses out a hundred! Ross Taylor is caught behind off Mohammed Shami for 93 runs. Ish Sodhi is the new man in.

New Zealand: 222/7 in 45.1 overs

details.title: Runs dry up
details.content:
After the fall off Ross Taylor, runs are hard to come for the Kiwis. Ish Sodhi and Doug Bracewell try hard to keep the scorecard ticking.

New Zealand: 230/7 in 47 overs

details.title: Dropped and caught
details.content:
A rare dropped catch from Virat Kohli as he fumbles running in from long-on. He makes amends the next time he got the oppurtunity to get Ish Sodhi out off the bowling of Shami. 

New Zealand: 239/8 in 48 overs

details.title: Run-out
details.content:
Virat on point again as he gets Doug Bracewell run-out at the non-striker's end. Trent Boult was the batsman and he did not call for a run while Bracewell had already taken a few strides and could not come back to the crease. As easy a run-out as it gets.

New Zealand: 239/4

details.title: All-out
details.content:
That's a wrap! Another Kiwi collapse as they are bowled out for 243 runs in 49 overs. Trent Boult is the last man to go as he skies it to Mohammed Shami who takes the catch running in from third-man.

New Zealand: 243 all-out

details.title: Target
details.content: India need 243 runs to win series and take a 3-0 lead. This is also skipper Virat Kohli's last game of the series as he has been rested for the remainder of the ODI series and the T20I series against the Kiwis.

details.title: Innings in pictures
details.content:
Innings Break!

New Zealand all out for 243 in 49 overs (Shami 3/41, Hardik 2/45)

The dinner break has been reduced to 30 minutes for today's game

Scorecard - https://t.co/0SXKeJvZSs #NZvIND pic.twitter.com/lukAdaoZwc

— BCCI (@BCCI) January 28, 2019

details.title: Ross Taylor top scored for the hosts
details.content:
India bowl New Zealand out for 243 in the penultimate over!

Ross Taylor top-scored with a 106-ball 93 while Tom Latham made 51 in the third ODI at the Bay Oval.#NZvIND LIVE 👇https://t.co/C81irzrren pic.twitter.com/O5zsLYEZ3q

— ICC (@ICC) January 28, 2019

details.title: It's Sunny out there
details.content:
Why Sunny why?? #NZvIND pic.twitter.com/t4jBSgfhpo

— The Goan Patiala 🥃 (@TheGoanPatiala) January 28, 2019

details.title: Rohit, Dhawan get us underway
details.content: Trent Boult has the new ball and the Kiwis will be looking for early wickets.

details.title: Close but no cigar
details.content:
Doug Bracewell brings Rohit Sharma forward and gets the edge but it falls short of first slip. To compound that, Dhawan decides to take control as he ends the second over with three successive fours.

India 16/0 after 2 overs

details.title: Runs continue to flow
details.content:
Rohit finally gets in on the act with a gentle flick off his pads but it is Dhawan, who continues to dominate as he has already brought up his fourth boundary in 14 balls.

India 26/0 after 4 overs

details.title: Well, well, well
details.content: A maiden over from Lockie Ferguson as Rohit Sharma decides, like Queen Elsa in Frozen, to let it go.

details.title: India unable to pick Lock-ie so far
details.content:
Lockie Ferguson has kept things quiet so far but the Black Caps need wickets not just dot balls.

India 39/0 after 8 overs

details.title: First blood for New Zealand
details.content:
OUT! Shikhar Dhawan has to go for 28 as Trent Boult brings him forward and takes the outside edge. Ross Taylor completes the simple catch at first slip.

India 39/1 after 8.2 overs

details.title: Runs starting to dry
details.content:
Eight runs off the last four overs and two of them have been maidens. The last by Trent Boult was a wicket maiden. The Black Caps have put on the squeeze.

India 39/1 after 9 overs

details.title: Can the Kiwis capitalize?
details.content:
Kohli hasn't got off the mark and for the Black Caps to have any chance, they need to ensure that they get rid of both him and Rohit quickly.

India 44/1 after 10 overs

details.title: First sign of spin and Kohli is off the mark
details.content:
The runs have dried and it takes Kohli eight balls to finally get off the mark. But India are still in control of the chase.

India 52/1 after 12 overs

details.title: Kohli starts to click into gear
details.content:
After some tight bowling, the Black Caps bowl one short and wide and Kohli latches onto it like a starving man at a buffet table.

India 61/1 after 13 overs

details.title: Another day, another milestone for Rohit
details.content: STAT ATTACK: Rohit Sharma becomes the fourth-fastest Indian to complete 10,000 runs in List-A cricket. He got there in 260 innings and became the 10th Indian to complete the milestone.

details.title: India continue to chip away
details.content:
Rohit is keen on dancing down and taking advantage of the spinner while Kohli is happy enough to keep the scoreboard moving. This is starting to look ominous for New Zealand.

India 75/1 after 16 overs

details.title: Spin to win for the Kiwis
details.content:
Ish Sodhi and Mitchell Santner are operating in tandem as Kane Williamson turns to his spin twins in his quest to break this partnership.

India 80/1 after 18 overs

details.title: Fifty partnership up
details.content:
Kohli brings up the fifty partnership for the second wicket in style. A regal flick off his pads and that is yet another fifty partnership between Rohit and Kohli.

India 93/1 after 20 overs

details.title: Get, set, Kohli
details.content:
After taking eight balls to get off the mark and batting at a strike rate of under 60 until a few overs ago, it would have been easy to assume that this just wasn't Kohli's day. But a flurry of boundaries, deft touches and elegant flicks have got him back on track.

India 103/1 after 21 overs

details.title: Fifty for Rohit Sharma
details.content:
STAT ATTACK: Rohit Sharma now has 39 ODI fifties. That is his 47th fifty-plus score as opener, moving level with Mark Waugh on 15th spot on the list of most fifty-plus scores by an opener in ODIs.

India 118/1 after 23 overs

details.title: Raining boundaries at the Bay Oval
details.content:
Both Rohit and Kohli have decided to press the accelerator and the Kiwi bowlers simply have no answer to the onslaught.

India 130/1 after 24 overs

details.title: Rohit on a roll
details.content:
As calm as you like...

Back-to-back fifties for @ImRo45. Top class!#CricketMeriJaan #NZvIND pic.twitter.com/nyuEBDpON2

— Mumbai Indians (@mipaltan) January 28, 2019

details.title: Fifty for Kohli
details.content:
He was having some issues with his eyes but he is seeing alright as he smokes a six and then brings up his fifty with a single down to long on.

India 143/1 after 26.1 overs

details.title: Kohli, Rohit now in third spot on all-time list
details.content: STAT ATTACK: Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma have been involved in 16 century partnerships in ODIs. Only two pairs, Sachin/Ganguly (26) and Sangakkara/Dilshan (20) have more century partnerships in ODI history.

details.title: Kiwis finally get the breakthrough
details.content:
OUT! Rohit dances down the track and tries to hit Santner out of the Bay Oval but makes no contact with the ball and ends up getting stumped as the left-arm spinner throws it wide.

India 152/2 after 28.5 overs

details.title: BREAKING: Rayudu suspended from bowling by ICC
details.content: In other news, Ambati Rayudu has been suspended from bowling by the ICC. He elected not to submit to a test of his action within 14 days after he was reported for suspect action during the first ODI against Australia.

details.title: Rayudu keeps India on track
details.content:
He might be suspended from bowling but that has done nothing to hamper his batting as Rayudu comes out and hits three boundaries in his first seven balls.

India 168/2 in 31 overs

details.title: India in a spot of bother
details.content:
OUT! Virat Kohli picks out Nicholls at cover and India have now lost two quick wickets. The required rate is under control but now two new batsmen are at the crease and the Kiwis have a glimmer of hope.

India 168/3 after 31.1 overs

details.title: India 178/3 in 34 overs
details.content: Karthik, Rayudu starting to stitch together a partnership. With the required rate not an issue, the two can get some quality time in the middle.

details.title: Slow but surely getting there
details.content:
The hosts had a sniff after a couple of quick wickets but Rayudu and Karthik have managed to steady the ship. 

India 186/3 after 35 overs

details.title: 200 up for India
details.content:
Both Rayudu and Karthik have mixed aggression with patience expertly and now India need just 44 to seal the ODI series.

India 200/3 after 37 overs

Rayudu and Pandya Two players remained suspended today. pic.twitter.com/UwgXYXvoHz

— The Goan Patiala 🥃 (@TheGoanPatiala) January 28, 2019

details.title: Rayudu, Karthik bring up fifty partnership
details.content:
Rayudu and Karthik are both not assured of a spot in the starting XI when everyone is fit but they can strengthen their case if they can guide India over the line here. They are on track so far.

India 218/3 after 40 overs

details.title: We are almost there
details.content:
Rayudu is just toying with the the Kiwi bowlers now. To a ball that is not too short and not too wide, he goes for the upper cut and picks up a boundary that brings the target to under 20.

India 227/3 after 42 overs

details.title: India one hit away from victory
details.content:
It might well come down to Dinesh Karthik vs Ambati Rayudu for a spot in the Indian middle-order. And on today's evidence it is going to be a tough call for the selectors.

India 240/3 after 43 overs

details.title: India take an unassailable 3-0 lead in ODI series
details.content: And it is all over. A wide that goes to the ropes and India have registered another convincing victory over New Zealand. This time by seven wickets with seven overs to spare.

Here is the complete report from the day's game.

http://www.newindianexpress.com/sport/cricket/2019/jan/28/india-beat-new-zealand-by-seven-wickets-in-third-odi-1931095.html
